p: Samples of the diets and ingredients were collected and stored at −20°C until analysis. During the 5-d collection period, all feces were promptly collected into plastic bags and stored at −20°C according to the methods described by Song et al [ 16] and Ren et al [ 17]. At the end of collection period, the total 5-d production of feces from each pig was pooled and weighed, and a subsample of 300 g was taken and dried in a forced-draft oven at 65°C for 72 h. After drying and grinding, subsamples were stored at −20°C for further chemical analysis.
